prompt: The lightning-marked nymph is awake again, grooming itself in the mushroom light. Howen observes its distinctive features—the crack pattern, the slight iridescence beginning on its carapace, the way it holds its mandibles. This one needs a name. Purple light catches the developing iridescence on the nymph's shell as it grooms, the lightning-mark clearly visible. Style: Portrait study, identity consideration. Mood: Contemplative, identity-giving, significant moment.
caption: You need a name, little one. You are too important to just be 'the nymph.'
narration: Names have power. A farmer names the prize animal, the productive field, the reliable tool. This one had earned a name.
